workflow.name: Auto-answer GitHub PR questions with GPT-4o, Notion & Slack for dev teams
workflow.description:
## üìò Description:
This workflow automates developer Q&A handling by connecting GitHub, GPT-4o (Azure OpenAI), Notion, Google Sheets, and Slack.
 Whenever a developer comments on a pull request with a ‚Äúhow do I‚Ä¶‚Äù or ‚Äúhow to‚Ä¶‚Äù question, the workflow automatically detects the query, uses GPT-4o to generate a concise technical response, stores it in Notion for documentation, and instantly shares it on Slack for visibility.
 It reduces repetitive manual answering, boosts engineering knowledge sharing, and keeps teams informed with AI-powered insights.

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)

üü¢ GitHub PR Comment Trigger ‚Äî Starts the automation when a pull request comment is posted in a specified repository.
Action: Listens for pull_request_review_comment events.
Description: Captures comment text, author, PR number, and repository name as the trigger payload.

üîç Validate GitHub Webhook Payload (IF Node) ‚Äî Ensures the webhook data includes a valid comment URL.
 ‚úÖ True Path: Continues to question detection.
 ‚ùå False Path: Sends invalid or missing data to Google Sheets for error logging.

‚ùì Detect Developer Question in PR Comment ‚Äî Checks whether the comment includes question patterns such as ‚Äúhow do I‚Ä¶‚Äù or ‚Äúhow to‚Ä¶‚Äù.
 If a valid question is found, the workflow proceeds to the AI assistant; otherwise, it ends silently.

üß† Configure GPT-4o Model (Azure OpenAI) ‚Äî Connects to the GPT-4o model for intelligent language generation.
 Acts as the central AI engine to craft short, precise technical answers.

ü§ñ Generate AI Response for Developer Question ‚Äî Sends the developer‚Äôs comment and PR context to GPT-4o.
 GPT analyzes the question and produces a short (2‚Äì3 line) helpful answer, maintaining professional and technical tone.

üß© Extract GitHub Comment Metadata ‚Äî Uses a JavaScript code node to structure key details (repo, user, comment, file path, PR number) into a clean JSON format.
 Prepares standardized data for storage and further use.

üßæ Save Comment Insight to Notion Database ‚Äî Appends the GitHub comment, AI response, and metadata into a Notion database (‚Äútest db‚Äù).
 Acts as a centralized knowledge base for tracking and reusing AI-generated technical answers.

üí¨ Post AI Answer & PR Link to Slack ‚Äî Sends the generated response and GitHub PR comment link to a Slack channel or user.
 Helps reviewers or teammates instantly view AI-generated suggestions and maintain active discussion threads.

üö® Log Errors in Google Sheets (Error Handling) ‚Äî Logs webhook validation or AI-processing errors into a shared Google Sheet (‚Äúerror log sheet‚Äù).
 Ensures full visibility into workflow issues for future debugging.

## üß© Prerequisites
- GitHub OAuth credentials with webhook access
- Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o) account
- Notion API integration for the documentation database
- Slack API connection for notifications
- Google Sheets API access for error tracking

## üí° Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Automated detection of developer questions in GitHub comments
 ‚úÖ AI-generated instant answers with context awareness
 ‚úÖ Centralized documentation in Notion for knowledge reuse
 ‚úÖ Real-time Slack notifications for visibility and collaboration
 ‚úÖ Continuous error logging for transparent troubleshooting

## üë• Perfect For
- Developer teams using GitHub for code reviews
- Engineering leads wanting AI-assisted PR support
- Companies aiming to build self-learning documentation
- Teams using Notion and Slack for workflow visibility

parameters.content:
## Node Name: GitHub PR Comment Trigger
**Action**: Starts the workflow when a pull-request comment event occurs in GitHub.
**Description**:
This node listens for the `pull_request_review_comment` webhook from a specified repository (`weather-app`) and user.  
Whenever a developer comments on a PR, this node captures the event payload ‚Äî including comment text, file path, PR number, and author ‚Äî to start the automation chain.

## Node Name: Validate GitHub Webhook Payload
**Action**: Checks if the incoming PR comment data is valid and complete.
**Description**:
Before processing, this node verifies that the GitHub payload includes a valid comment URL.  
If the webhook is malformed or missing fields, the workflow routes execution to the error-logging path to prevent failed AI or Notion operations.

## Node Name: Log Errors in Google Sheets
**Action**: Records any webhook or processing errors in a shared Google Sheet.
**Description**:
If validation fails or data parsing encounters issues, this node logs the error details (error ID + message) in the ‚Äúerror log sheet.‚Äù  
This ensures complete visibility into failed webhook events and AI generation errors for future troubleshooting.

## Node Name: Generate AI Response for Developer Question
**Action**: Uses GPT-4o to draft a clear, concise reply to the developer‚Äôs PR comment.
**Description**:
This agent node sends the extracted GitHub comment text and PR context to GPT-4o.  
The AI analyzes the query and returns a brief (2‚Äì3 line) technical answer that can later be stored or displayed for review.

## Node Name: Extract GitHub Comment Metadata
**Action**: Parses and structures key GitHub comment details into a clean JSON object.
**Description**:
Using a JavaScript Code node, this step extracts repository name, comment content, author username, file path, and PR number from the original webhook payload.  
It standardizes the data so it can be easily stored in Notion.

## Node Name: Save Comment Insight to Notion Database
**Action**: Appends the processed comment data and AI response into a Notion database.
**Description**:
This node creates a new page entry in a Notion database (‚Äútest db‚Äù) capturing details like repository, username, comment body, file path, and PR number.  
It serves as a living documentation hub for tracking developer queries and AI answers from GitHub PRs.

## Node Name: Configure GPT-4o Model
**Action**: Establishes the Azure OpenAI GPT-4o model connection for AI processing.
**Description**:
This node defines and connects to the GPT-4o model hosted on Azure OpenAI.  
It serves as the language engine for generating short, precise, and context-aware technical responses to developer comments.

## Node Name: Detect Developer Question in PR Comment
**Action**: Evaluates whether a PR comment contains a question like ‚Äúhow do I‚Ä¶‚Äù or ‚Äúhow to‚Ä¶‚Äù.
**Description**:
This conditional node scans the text of the GitHub comment for help-related keywords.  
If the comment is a technical query, it routes the flow to the AI assistant for generating a concise answer. Otherwise, the workflow ends silently.

nodes.name: Detect Developer Question in PR Comment
Generate AI Response for Developer Question

options.systemMessage:
=You are a helpful developer assistant. 
Provide short, clear, and technically correct answers (2‚Äì3 lines max) to developer questions found in GitHub PR comments.

nodes.name: Save Comment Insight to Notion Database

parameters.content:
## Node Name: Post AI Answer & PR Link to Slack
**Action**: Sends the generated AI response and the GitHub PR comment link to a Slack channel or user.
**Description**:
This node posts the AI-generated technical answer (from ‚ÄúGenerate AI Response for Developer Question‚Äù) directly to Slack, followed by the original GitHub PR comment link for quick context.  
It ensures that the internal team (or reviewer) is instantly notified whenever a developer‚Äôs query is processed by the AI system ‚Äî allowing faster review and collaboration inside Slack.  
Typically used to streamline developer feedback loops and keep AI-assisted responses visible to the engineering team in real time.

nodes.name: Post AI Answer & PR Link to Slack

parameters.text: ={{ $('Generate AI Response for Developer Question').item.json.output }}{{ $('Detect Developer Question in PR Comment').item.json.body.comment.url }}

user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
